comment.body: I would do it like this, follow any normal tracker tutorial, use tracker written in go because fuck  this is 2016 man of course everything has to be rewritten in golang. Then use (careful) iptables -P INPUT DROP && standard related established allowed, icmp allow, then iptables -A INPUT -p tcp -s 42.42.42.1/12 -j ACCEPT and the same for -p udp, that is accept only that IP-range/subnet. or add more of these "subnet allowed" lists. In short: do the filtering on range of IP, or lists of IP, with iptables, and let the tracker think its doing fine.
